result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance Lee Hage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay court ordered costs/surcharges from bond on deposit with any remaining balance according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.

No possession or consumption of alcohol; No entrance into bars or taverns without advanced written permission of Probation & Parole;  Provide a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge; Pay court ordered costs/surcharges; Comply with any assessment or counseling as set up by Probation & Parole.

timeConds.notes: Serve 32 days in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 32 days served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance Lee Hage

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Rec'd documentation from DOC that defendant paid in full all obligations.  Hearing removed for 4/3/17.
Probation review hearing on April 3, 2017 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terrance Lee Hage in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Terrance Lee Hage in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel informs the court of plea negotiations.  Defendant will plead to count 2 in 15CF18, other counts will be DRI; defendant will plead in 15CF23 as Deferred Agreement.  Court advises defendant of elements of count 2 in 15CF18, misdemeanor battery, domestic abuse related/max. penalties; and elements of count 1 in 15CF23, felony bail jumping/max penalties.  Court informs defendant if complies with DPA, case dismissed, if violates agreement, agreement could be revoked and plea accepted; advises defendant of felony prohibitions if convicted. Defendant pleads no contest to count 2 in 15CF18 and pleads guilty to count 1 in 15CF23.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea in count 2 of 15CF18 and finds defendant guilty.  Court defers acceptance of guilty plea in 15CM23 and approves the DPA.  Court DRI counts 1 & 3 in 15CF18.  State informs court of joint recommendation of 2 yrs. probation with conditions:  no drink; no bars or taverns; 32 days jail, time served.  Court notes DNA sample, costs, comply with any assessment or counseling as set up by Probation & Parole.  Defense counsel agrees.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 yrs. probation with conditions:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entrance into bars or taverns without advanced written permission of Probation & Parole; 32 days in the PCJ with credit for 32 days served; provide a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge; pay costs & domestic abuse surcharge; comply with any assessment or counseling as set up by Probation & Parole; apply bond; advises defendant of appeal rights.

Defendant Terrance Lee Hage in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Terrance Lee Hage in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of elements of charges/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  NGP entered.  Atty Rivard requests modification of bond for court to consider out-patient treatment, signature bond or $500-$700 cash bond.  State objects, needs to be in-patient treatment.  State VWC spoke with Pepin County Housing Authority and he's banned from the premises unless he's in in-patient treatment.  Court orders bond remains a previously set.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Terrance Lee Hage in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Terrance Lee Hage in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives P.H.  Waiver form filed with the court.  Counsel to proceed with arraignment on basis of complaint.

$1000.00 cash bond reinstated less $400.00 already posted.
No possession or consumption of alcohol.  
Or defendant may be released from jail directly into in-patient residential treatment program as long as the jail is furnished with proof there is a bed available; when leave the program, defendant shall return directly to jail.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terrance Lee Hage in court with attorney Patrick Waters of SPD sitting in for Atty Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of new charge in 15CF23/max. penalties and rights and rights to preliminary hearing.  State requests $1000 cash bond on new charge and reinstate original bond of $1000 cash in 15CF18 and give credit for the $400 on deposit, for total cash bond on 2 cases of $2000.00.  Atty Waters requests court no impose $2000 cash bond and request the order for in-patient treatment be kept in the bond and not impose more cash bond.  Court notes the address on complaint is the address in which Mr. Hage was removed.  Court will not forfeit bond at this time and sets cash bond of $1000 on new charge and increase bond on other charge from $400 to $1000 and on both include provision to be released into in-patient treatment and no possession or consumption of alcohol.

No drinking;
No entrance into bars or taverns

Defendant Terrance Lee Hage in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Terrance Lee Hage in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters requests to modify bond to $400 cash which defendant can post.  Court modifies bond to $400 cash with conditions:  no drinking; no bars or taverns.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Terrance Lee Hage in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights and right to preliminary hearing.  State requests $1000 cash bond with condition no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Victim appears.  Court notes a lady came to the window, didn't speak to her but she indicated he needs treatment.  Court sets $1000 cash bond and if bond out, no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Court approves release from jail directly into in-patient residential treatment program as long as the jail is furnished with proof there is a bed available; when leave the program, return directly to jail.  Matter continued to tomorrow at 2:30 p.m.  Encourages defendant to contact SPD Office.

No possession or consumption of alcohol.  
Court approves release from jail directly into in-patient residential treatment program as long as the jail is furnished with proof there is a bed available; when leave the program, return directly to jail.
